com.realobjects.pdfreactor

Class Configuration.Resource

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.realobjects.pdfreactor.Configuration.Resource
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Configuration.ScriptResource
    Enclosing class:
    Configuration

    public static class Configuration.Resource
extends Object

    A type containing data for external resources such as style sheets.

      Resource() 
      Resource(String content, String uri)
      Deprecated.

      Configuration.Resource setBeforeDocumentScripts(Boolean value)
      Use true to cause PDFreactor to run the script before all scripts inside the document and false to run it after.

    • Method Detail

      • setContent

        public Configuration.Resource setContent(String value)

        The content of the resource. Only supported for Style Sheet- and Script-type resources.

        Returns:
        The current Configuration.Resource instance.
        See Also:
        Configuration.setUserStyleSheets(Resource...), Configuration.setXsltStyleSheets(Resource...), Configuration.setUserScripts(Resource...)

      • setUri

        public Configuration.Resource setUri(String value)

        The URI of the resource.

        Returns:
        The current Configuration.Resource instance.

      • setInputSource

        public Configuration.Resource setInputSource(InputSource value)

        The InputSource of the resource. Only supported for CSS-type resources.

        Returns:
        The current Configuration.Resource instance.
        See Also:
        Configuration.setUserStyleSheets(Resource...)

      • setData

        public Configuration.Resource setData(byte[] value)

        The binary data of the resource.

        Returns:
        The current Configuration.Resource instance.
        See Also:
        Configuration.setMergeDocuments(Resource...)

      • setBeforeDocumentScripts

        public Configuration.Resource setBeforeDocumentScripts(Boolean value)

        Use true to cause PDFreactor to run the script before all scripts inside the document and false to run it after.

        Only supported for JavaScript-type resources.

        Returns:
        The current Configuration.Resource instance.
        See Also:
        Configuration.setUserScripts(Resource...)
